intro: Helicia whelanii, commonly known as the Whelan's helicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
